In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here is an example of how you could define the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10, sep::String=" ")
    words = split(s, sep)
    lines = AbstractString[]
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line * sep * word) > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = word
        else
            if isempty(line)
                line = word
            else
                line *= sep * word
            end
        end
    end
    if!isempty(line)
        push!(lines, line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

This function first splits the input string `s` into an array of words using the `split` function. Then, it initializes an empty array `lines` to store the lines of text, and an empty string `line` to construct
